name.en: Department of Bio and Environmental Physics

structural_unit_name.en: Department of Bio and Environmental Physics

description.en: Hydrodynamics (the fluid mechanics) is a special branch of theoretical mechanics. Fluids and gases are considered as continuous environments, neglecting their molecular structure. However, for explanation of some properties of fluids and gases, e.g. the viscosity, their discrete internal structure is considered. The lecture course is focusing on simple everyday hydrodynamics problems: compressibility of liquids and gases, hydraulic shock, wind damages of roofs, water supply in buildings, planning of bursting and watering, siphoning, measurements of blood pressure, ventilation of internal rooms.
description.et:
Hüdrodünaamika kirjeldab vedelike ja gaaside liikumist ja on osa teoreetilisest mehhaanikast. Vedelikke ja gaase käsitletakse kui pidevaid voolavaid keskkondi, võrrandites ei kajastu aine molekulaarne struktuur. Küll aga kasutatakse aine molekulaarset ehitust vedeliku või gaasi mõnede omaduste, näiteks sisehõõrdeteguri, selgitamiseks. 
Loengukursuses on vaatluse all lihtsaid hüdrodünaamikateadmisi nõudvad igapäevaelu probleemid: vedelike ja gaaside kokkusurutavus, hüdrauliline löök, hoonete katuste tuulekahjustused, kõrgemate korruste veevarustus, purskamis-, kastmis- ja ümbervalamisülesanded, lennukitiiva kujud, tsentrifuugimine, langemine gaasides ja vedelikes, vereringe, siseruumide ventileerimine.

objectives.en: To acquire basic knowledge on hydrodynamics for understanding motion of fluids and gases in the nature (the ocean and the atmosphere), in technologocal systems (pipes, tubes) and in the human bodies (the blood system).
objectives.et: Omandada hüdrodünaanika alusteadmised mõistmaks vedelike ja gaaside liikumist looduses (meres, atmosfääris), tehnosüsteemides (torud) ja inimkehas (vereringe).

learning_outcomes.en: Intended learning outcomes (ILOs). Upon completion of this course, the participants are trained to:
1.	Understand the basic quantities and laws of hydrodynamics.
2.	Perceive causes of wind damages on buildings and to outline avoiding of such damages.
learning_outcomes.et: 2.	Mõistavad võimalike tuulekahjustuste põhjusi hoonetele ja anda soovitusi nende vältimiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: 3.	Explain free fall of bodies in the gases and liquids.
learning_outcomes.et: 3.	Oskavad kirjeldada kehade vaba langemist gaasides ja vedelikes.

learning_outcomes.en: 4.	 Know how to solve problems of bursting,watering and free falling.
learning_outcomes.et: 4.	Teavad, kuidas lahendada purskamis-,  kastmis- ja vaba langemise ülesandeid.

learning_outcomes.en: 5.	To outline update of water supply and ventilation systems in buildings.
learning_outcomes.et: 5.	On võimelised planeerima veevarustuse ja ventilatsiooni parandamist hoonetes.

learning_outcomes.en: 7.	Are able to perform calculations of centrifugation.

independent_work.et:
Learn the worked examples in the Lecture notes.
Try to solve all exercises from the Lecture notes.You are supposed to explain your solutions.
------------------------------------

grade_evaluation.et:
Mark grade A means:  91-100 points from the Examination Test.
----
Mark grade B: 81-90 points.
----
Mark grade C: 71-80 points.
----
Mark grade D: 61-70 points.
----
Mark grade E: 51-60 points.
----
Mark grade F: 50 or less points.
-----------------------------------------

debt_elimination.et: The mark grade F can be improved using another attempt. But only one chance will be given.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
McDonough, J. M., 2009. Lectures in elementary fluid dynamics: Physics, Mathematics and Applications. 
https://uknowledge.uky.edu/me_textbooks/1/
-------------------------- 
Borghini, N., 2015.  Elements of Hydrodynamics. 
https://www.physik.uni-bielefeld.de/~borghini/Teaching/Hydrodynamics15/Hydrodynamics.pdf
--------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
K. Laigna, 1997.  "Hüdromehaanika". Eesti Merehariduskeskus, 719 lk.
-------------------------
Maastik, A., Haldre, H., Koppel, T., Paal, L., 1995. Hüdraulika ja pumbad. Greif, Trt, 457 lk.

description.et:
Applied Fluid Mechanics
Lecture #1. 
Introduction to the lecture course and text-books. Definition of hydrodynamics. Concept of continuum. An ideal gas. Real gases. The Knudsen number. Terms of hydrodynamics. Compressibility of real fluids.  2h
--------------------

Lecture #2. 
Coefficient of compressibility and the bulk modulus. Hydrostatic formula (hydrostatic equation, pressure-head equation). Decibar in hydrology and oceanology. The units "bar" and "millibar". CTD sonds in oceanology. "Bathometer (English)" vs. "batomeeter" (Estonian). The World Ocean. Hydrostatic formula for the atmosphere. Compressibility of of the World Ocean.  2h
Demo. Upside down glass of water.
--------------------

Lecture #3.
Isothermal and adiabatic compressibility of perfect gases. Speed of sound in air and water. Echosoundings in water and air.  2h
Demo. The Archimedes screw. 
---------------------

Lecture #4.
General description and theory of hydraulic shock. Joukowsky's formulas. Protection against water hammer.
Attention! Flexible water hoses!  2h
-----------------------

Lecture #5.
Continuity of streamtube. Derivation of Bernoulli's equation. Some useful applications of Bernoulli's equation (hydrostatic pressure equation revisited). Pascal's law (principle). 2h
-----------------------

Lecture #6.
Review on the coming next week Training Test.
Flow along horizontal tubes. Does wind lift a roof? Water jet vacuum pump. 2h
Demo. Paper-cone in a glass funnel.
Demo. Water jet vacuum pump.
------------------------

Lecture #7.
Training Test.
A classic (Joukovsky) wing - how the lift-force appears? Angle of attack. Winglets. Cobra maneuvre. Mach number.  Roll, Pitch, Yaw.
What is the ideal competitive swimmer's body?  2h
------------------------

Lecture #8.
Comments on the training test. 
Static, dynamic and total pressure. Pitot tube. Magnus effect. Topspin hits in ball-games. 2h
Demo. Paper-cylinder on an inclined surface.
---------------------------

Lecture #9.
Derivation of Torricelli's formula. Drainage of a vessel. Siphon. Pythagorean cup. 2h
Demo. Siphon.
Demo. Pythagorean cup.
----------------------------

Lecture #10.
Viscosity. Causes of viscosity. Newton's law of viscosity. Coutte flow. Examples of viscosity. Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluids. Rheology.  2h
------------------------------

Lecture #11.
Viscous flow in pipes. Parabolic profile of velocity. Hagen-Poiseuille volumetric formula. 2h
-----------------------------

Lecture #12.
Free fall in a viscous environment. Galileo at the Tower of Pisa. Apollo 15 mission. Viscous fall at a laminar regime, Stokes' formula. A fog droplet in the atmosphere. What does a raindrop actually look like? A ball in the stream of air. River safety, railway safety.  2h
Demo. Suspending ball in a stream of air.
-----------------------------

Lecture #13.
Gravitational sedimentation and floating. Centrifugation for cream skimming: Antonin & Alexander Prandtl, Gustaf de Laval. Laboratory centrifuges. Sedimentation coefficient, its unit, svedberg. Swim horizontal or uphill?  2h
----------------------------

Lecture #14.
Blood circulation. Blood properties and functions. Measurement of blood pressure. Healthy and unhealthy blood pressure ranges. Fatigue of muscles, preinfarction phase, infarction, disease prevention and treatment. Blood pressure in veins.
Window. How a window should not be planned. 
Review items for the examination testing.  2h
-------------------------------

Lecture #15.
Examination Test, the 1st time. Open materials (incl. Lecture notes, Internet, AI). 2h
-------------------------------------
